name: Theopemptus and Theonas
Syncletica
troparia: (Tone 4) After Elijah had gone up to heaven,* Elisha threw his mantle in the Jordan River which parted,* opening a way, a dry path between two walls of water, where he could pass,* a true symbol of our baptism by which we pass through this fleeting life.* Christ has been seen at the Jordan River* to sanctify the waters.
kontakia: (Tone 4) Today the Lord stood in Jordanâ€™s current telling John:* Do not be afraid to baptize Me,* for I have come to save Adam, the first man.
